intro: Ochyrella brachycentron, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ochyrella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves that resemble those of other members of its family. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its inflorescence consists of numerous tiny white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. Ochyrella brachycentron is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
